thread.title: Bulls stun Celtics after controversial foul results in winning free throws
thread.title_full: Bulls stun Celtics after controversial foul results in winning free throws

author: Brian
title: Bulls stun Celtics after controversial foul results in winning free throws
text:
Feb 16, 2017 at 11:24p ET 0Shares 
The ‚Äúunwritten rules‚Äù of basketball suffered a serious defeat at United Center on Thursday night, when the Chicago Bulls defeated the Boston Celtics 104-103 in controversial fashion. Bulls star Jimmy Butler was awarded two free throws, with less than a second remaining, after his elbow was grazed by Marcus Smart during his buzzer-beating attempt. Smart fouls Jimmy Butler on the final shot & Butler makes both free throws to give @chicagobulls the 104-103 lead w/ 0.9 seconds üëÄ pic.twitter.com/Aa0WORC7Dh 
‚Äî NBA on TNT (@NBAonTNT) February 17, 2017 
Let‚Äôs take a closer look: Did Marcus Smart catch a piece of that elbow?üî¨ pic.twitter.com/QRQzxVbD42 
‚Äî NBA on ESPN (@ESPNNBA) February 17, 2017 
If you pause the replay at the right second, it does appear that Smart did just get a piece of the elbow: 
‚Ä¶and that technically constitutes a foul under the rules of basketball, in which Butler stepped to the line and made both free throws: . @JimmyButler 's free throws to seal the victory! pic.twitter.com/JFJmccfXST 
‚Äî Chicago Bulls (@chicagobulls) February 17, 2017 
but, that is a tough call to make with the game on the line. 
Let ‚Äôem play or make the call? Basketball‚Äôs never-ending argument continues.
